Si parlava di questo "famoso" PvE che avrebbe rivoluzionato il gioco. Quello che abbiamo visto, e a detta degli sviluppatori, non è quello che avevano inizialmente perché a detta loro risultava troppo difficile da sviluppare e così è stato nerfato pesantemente, portando 3 missioni in croce che non portano da nessuna parte (oltre a qualche sfida)... niente progresso vero e proprio dei personaggi, ma solo badge e sfide.

Ora è il momento di fare le cose serie, far rinascere un gioco che ha dimostrato di saper fare bene queste cose, ma affossato perché troppo "complesso" nelle meccaniche e che non avesse una sua "identità", il tutto favorendo Overwatch che usci un paio di settimane dopo e altamente fan-service per casual gamers.
Ad Overwatch 2 ci giocherò un po' solo per farmare qualche achievements, ma niente di più.

《overwatch》或许是无罪的，但是你暴雪必须得死。
17年的夏天，我满怀期待地买下当时定价98元的《守望先锋》，那是我最愉悦的一个假期。
……
你是不是以为我接下来要开始回忆了？回忆个锤子！暴雪在恶心玩家这方面从来不会让人失望。
从一款优秀的fps游戏到社会仇恨模拟器，只经历了不到一年的时间。
从性骚扰丑闻到给网易加码，鼠目寸光的臭傻逼考迪克似乎对于暴雪的死活早已视而不见，捞钱成为了唯一的目的。
但是您猜怎么着，我他妈也不在乎暴雪的死活，但是考迪克，或者说“考迪克们”死不死，对我来说很重要。
要是你还有点良心，赶紧吞枪自杀吧，天天烤迪克的杂种考迪克。

In the ever-evolving landscape of gaming, Overwatch 2 stands as a testament to the enduring appeal of its predecessor. Despite the occasional chorus of concerns and criticisms, my affection for this franchise remains as steadfast as it was for the original Overwatch. It's worth noting that the PVE aspect hasn't captured my personal attention; nevertheless, the widespread sensationalism of the game's issues seems overplayed. In reality, Overwatch 2 retains its essence as an enjoyable experience, particularly when embarked upon in the company of friends.

While some voices might raise valid points about the game's development journey, it's important to recognize the dedication of the development team at Blizzard Entertainment. As they navigate the intricate process of fine-tuning a complex multiplayer universe, we're presented with a refined iteration of the cherished world that captured our hearts years ago.

Delving into the multiplayer arena, the familiar thrill of diverse heroes and their unique abilities remains a cornerstone of Overwatch 2's charm. As we venture into battles of strategy and skill, the synergy between team members and the strategic depth of gameplay offer a rewarding experience that keeps us coming back for more. While certain concerns might surface from time to time, it's essential to acknowledge that every evolving title encounters its share of hurdles and adaptations.

Among the critiques that have echoed across the community, the focus on player-versus-environment (PVE) gameplay might not resonate with every player. However, it's crucial to remember that diversity in offerings is a hallmark of growth and innovation. The inclusion of PVE elements is a testament to Blizzard's commitment to expanding the Overwatch universe, catering to a broader audience with diverse gaming preferences.

Ultimately, the heart of Overwatch 2 remains a celebration of camaraderie and competition. Whether it's chasing victories or crafting unforgettable moments with friends, the core experience remains undeniably engaging. To those who fear the shadows of skepticism, I implore you to embrace the essence of the Overwatch universe. Let's not forget that great games are forged through dedication, collaboration, and the unwavering passion of both developers and players.

In conclusion, Overwatch 2 isn't simply a game; it's an ongoing journey. It's a testament to the shared memories, fierce rivalries, and heart-pounding moments that define the realm of competitive gaming. So, as we tread forward into this next chapter, let's remember that every concern, every glitch, and every debate contributes to the narrative of growth. Overwatch 2 stands as a testament to our collective dedication to the world of gaming, and I, for one, remain excited for the chapters yet to come.

This is not a "fake" review, but a a review I've been waiting for years to make. OW2 is a terrible game made by a terrible company. Maybe don't gut your PvE you promised before gutting OW1, and maybe treat your employees right before desperately trying to push your game to other platforms. Take this L.

Also, fun fact: I got banned from the steam forums for criticizing this game for inappropriate language. The post was taken down, but where was the inappropriate language? Was using 7 asterisks in a row to describe what Blizzard was scare you that much? Or were you just trying to censor criticism?
垃圾游戏，傻逼暴雪还我国服数据，那么多小时的国区数据说没就没，ow2的出现也是狗屎一坨，一手好牌大的稀碎，这还是我记忆中那个陪我青春的游戏吗。

我还记得那个晚上，那时我刚刚高中毕业，从父母那里得到了一点小钱，我网购的电脑也到了。我毫不犹豫的买下了当时158的典藏版守望先锋一。
       虽然一开始很难上手，只能玩人机，也没人陪我玩，但我依然很开心。再后来，被骂，被嘲讽，被挑衅，我虽然很生气，天天和网友对骂，但我还是在玩这个游戏。在这里说一句，那些仗着自己游戏时长长的骂人的死妈玩意们，祝你全家天天和科摩多巨蜥开淫趴。
       事情都过去多久了？我对这个游戏已经没什么感觉了，我是20年入坑的，从来没见过辉煌时期的守望和黄金时代的暴雪。但我明白，游戏是曾经是好游戏，玩家曾经都是好玩家，暴雪曾经是好暴雪。考迪克你就是个机巴。

Overwatch 1 player and fan here.

Overwatch 1 was beautiful, each hero was really well done each cosmetic was really well thought, you could've purchased the game and played to get all the cosmetics slowly or swipe for loot boxes (mind you overwatch 1 made 1B$ in 2019 only from loot boxes), there were funny events and each time an event came they added new achievements to it, the UI was perfect in everything, even the sound effects were perfect, they had never lied us before, heroes were playable ON RELEASE FOR FREE. Then overwatch 2 happened

𝐋𝐢𝐞𝐬:
They lied sooo much, hero levels, full playable pve campaign that would've come for a box price, not making op  hero to sell the battlepass, they put GOLD credits in the battlepass to make it seem like it gave back what you spent like any other battlepass game (excluding some like Rainbow six) and then they changed it to white a day after, they stated that every battle pass from season 5 would've come packed with themed skins, but guess what season 6 has only 3 themed skins the rest is on sale for money.

𝐖𝐡𝐚𝐭 𝐚𝐫𝐞 𝐰𝐞 𝐥𝐞𝐟𝐭 𝐰𝐢𝐭𝐡?
Poorly thought skins or overly complicated skins without any concept art and no lore (mind you even epics had concept arts in ow1)
Overwatch 1 styled missions that you have to pay "individually" to play and last 20-30 minutes with 0 replayability.
Drip fed content, only 2 patches per season (2 months) and they dont even fix important stuff.
Balance is horrible (worse than overwatch 1 Imo).
Many people me included played alot for cosmetics, now you want 1? Good luck grinding 8 months of weeklies for 1 SINGLE legendary.
The cosmetics are overpriced as hell, what takes the 1 minute to recolor a skin is sold for 10€, a skin that is a recolor but with a wig? 20€
Copy pasted heroes that look like valorant agents for some reasons.

𝐓𝐡𝐞𝐲 𝐫𝐞𝐦𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐝 𝐚𝐧𝐲𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐰𝐚𝐭𝐜𝐡 𝟏 𝐡𝐚𝐝 𝐨𝐟 𝐟𝐮𝐧
free cosmetics, player levels, endorsement that actually gave rewards, medals, player cards, on fire, 6v6, achievements for new events.  HELL THEY EVEN REMOVED SOME VOICE LINES FOR NO REASON!

They reworked the sound effects even though they were perfect, and now they're worse.
And they're slowly adding everything back, they added on fire but its worse (btw 6 months after the game released while it was a thing for like 6 years before removing it for no reason), they added player levels but worse aka hero levels, and soon they will probably readd 6v6 or medals and cards but worse. Of course in a dripfed way.


𝐓𝐡𝐞 𝐔𝐈 𝐠𝐨𝐭 𝐰𝐨𝐫𝐬𝐞
From easy to travel to full of "to the battlepass" buttons and overly minimal UI.


𝟔𝐕𝟔 𝐫𝐞𝐦𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐝
6V6 was incredibly funny, Jeff Kaplan had said that 5v5 and 7v7 were too bad compared to the experience of 6v6, and he even stated in 2019 that 6v6 would've stayed. But guess what, they changed it to 5v5 with minimal changes and now the matchmaking is garbage cause its a rock paper scissors to who has the best tank.


𝐓𝐡𝐞 𝐛𝐚𝐥𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞 𝐢𝐬 𝐡𝐨𝐫𝐫𝐢𝐛𝐥𝐞
If your hero sucks , you're gonna have to wait THE WHOLE SEASON and have to HOPE they buff it and its not even guaranteed the buff is gonna make it any good, and if a hero is too strong then people gotta hope they nerf it or they could come out as "hmm we think its fine" and have ANOTHER 2 MONTHS of overpowered heroes.

𝐧𝐞𝐰 𝐡𝐞𝐫𝐨𝐞𝐬 𝐚𝐫𝐞 𝐥𝐨𝐜𝐤𝐞𝐝 𝐛𝐞𝐡𝐢𝐧𝐝 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐛𝐚𝐭𝐭𝐥𝐞 𝐩𝐚𝐬𝐬
this is huge, this is no game like rainbow six where it doesn't matter too much if you have the new hero, here you swap to counter and imagine going in competitive and not having the counter of a hero cause "you didn't swipe". And while you can grind for free its gonna take you several hours to reach the tier it gives for free, and if you dont reach it in time you're going to need to play the hero category and win 35 matches (mind you the game is set to be 50/50 winrate so its gonna take you 70 matches and 1 match is roughly 10 minutes on average, 700 minutes for 1 hero, imagine that in season 40).

𝐓𝐡𝐢𝐬 𝐠𝐚𝐦𝐞 𝐡𝐚𝐬 𝐧𝐨 𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐩𝐞𝐜𝐭 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐲𝐨𝐮 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐲𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞, 𝐢𝐭 𝐰𝐚𝐧𝐭𝐬 𝐲𝐨𝐮 𝐭𝐨 𝐨𝐩𝐞𝐧 𝐲𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐰𝐚𝐥𝐥𝐞𝐭.
Really go play any game that is possibly not a free to play, free to plays are the garbage of gaming and don't respect your time, a good game right now is Deep Rock Galactic, the developers are really good people and the only cosmetics they sell are through low priced dlcs and the battlepasses they add are free and if you don't complete it, they add everything to the loot pool or the shop. And if you're into fps I heard battlebit remastered is also really great if you ignore the krunker style grapich.


𝐓𝐡𝐞 𝐬𝐡𝐨𝐩 𝐠𝐨𝐭 𝐰𝐨𝐫𝐬𝐞
Its really incredible how overwatch 1 had the best shop in a game I've ever seen, everything was fairly priced and really understandable and u had not to wait and pray that the next weekly rotation will have the skin that you want (btw you're also paying now, funny huh?)
They're selling OVERWATCH 1 skins, skins that they made for people to earn are now being sold for 10€ EACH, and be quick to buy you might not get to see the fantastic skin that they're selling now and have no schedule on when its coming back!!! 
They also increased overwatch league skin cost and discontinued any overwatch 1 owl team skin for no reason other than  "buy it now quick!! before it'll never come back again, its just 4000$ for all the recolored team skins where probably 10% of it goes to team and 90% goes to the shareholders pockets!".

𝐖𝐞 𝐜𝐨𝐦𝐩𝐥𝐚𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐝 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐚 𝐛𝐞𝐭𝐭𝐞𝐫 𝐫𝐞𝐰𝐚𝐫𝐝𝐬 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐠𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐢𝐨𝐧
And what did we get? A hero progression system that basically forces you to play heroes you might not like thus throwing matches just to "reach level 200" to EARN WHAT? a player title....a player icon......Surely we feel rewarded now right?


𝐈𝐧 𝐜𝐨𝐧𝐜𝐥𝐮𝐬𝐢𝐨𝐧
Don't play the game other than to have fun sometime, if you want to devote time to this game find a better game its literally not worth it.
I don't think the problem is in the developers hands since even Jeff Kaplan (The leader of overwatch 1 who fought hard to not make overwatch shit) had to leave cause the higher ups didnt want to fund the game and wanted predatory monetization, something he fought for years to not have (reason why everything was attainable for free excluding some cosmetics in overwatch 1), the issue resides in the greed of shareholders / higher ups.
May overwatch rest in peace.

There's of course more bullshit I'm forgetting but this is all  I can remember right now.
If you read it all, thanks for reading.
